entry.title: Oregon Department of Forestry announces historic boost in funding to support equity in urban and community forestry
entry.summary: SALEM, Ore. – The Oregon Department of Forestry (ODF) seeks to fund projects that improve urban and community forests in areas of Oregon that need it the most. ODF’s Urban and Community Forestry (UCF) Program received $26.6 million from the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) through the United States Forest Service (USFS). Out of this, $10 million will be awarded to the nine Federally Recognized Tribes of Oregon, and $12.5 million will be available for all eligible entities in Oregon. This opportunity promotes equal access to the benefits of trees and aims to get more people involved in tree planting and comprehensive urban forest management. “This is going to be a game changer for Oregon,” said Scott Altenhoff, ODF’s UCF Program Manager. “This is the largest and most significant urban and comm…

entry.title: Zerbach sells lamb for over $5,700 at Douglas County Lamb Show
entry.summary: The 2024 Douglas County Lamb Show and Barbecue brought hundreds of lambs to the Douglas County Fairgrounds on Saturday as students competed, visitors watched and business representatives browsed the auction.

entry.title: McArthur graduates University of Alaska Fairbanks
entry.summary: Madeleine McArthur, of Glide, graduated May 4 from the University of Alaska Fairbanks with a Master of Science in marine biology.

entry.title: National Alliance on Mental Illness meeting Monday
entry.summary: NAMI Douglas County, the local chapter of the National Alliance on Mental Illness, will hold its monthly meeting 6-7:30 p.m. Monday at Vine Street Baptist Church, 2152 NE Vine St., Roseburg.

entry.title: Donations requested to benefit area youth
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Douglas County H.O.P.E. Drug Court Program is holding a Bridge the Gap Project to provide needed items to youth in the Adapt Deer Creek Adolescent Program.

entry.title: Rep. Hoyle requests funding for fourth district
entry.summary: Umpqua Community College and Douglas County Sheriff’s office are looking for federal funding to complete their projects. Help may soon be on the way.

entry.title: Killer whale spotted in the Umpqua River
entry.summary: WINCHESTER BAY — An orca made its way up the Umpqua River last weekend, likely to hunt.

entry.title: Windy Cove Crab and Fishing Dock remains closed, awaits permits for repairs
entry.summary: WINCHESTER BAY — Douglas County Parks Department closed the Windy Cove Crab and Fishing Dock on Feb. 1, and it will continue to be closed until the dock is repaired and deemed safe for use.

entry.title: With the tossing of caps, Roseburg High School class of 2024 bids farewell
entry.summary: With loud cheers, whoops, air horn blasts and some tears, Roseburg students threw their black caps in the air and walked off Finley Field as graduates.

entry.title: OHA seeks input on home health merger
entry.summary: OREGON — The Oregon Health Authority is looking for public comments regarding UnitedHealth Group Inc.'s plan to purchase Amedisys, a home health hospice company.

entry.title: Local GOP hosts Grassroots Cowboy Luau
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Douglas County Republican Central Committee has announced the creation of a special event and fundraiser for all Republicans to come celebrate in cowboy and Hawaiian style.

entry.title: Sutherlin High School celebrates graduates
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — The sea of blue gowns and decorated caps processed through the Sutherlin High School gym, as the seniors gathered for their last time as high school students.

entry.title: Roseburg Public Schools transitioning to ParentSquare
entry.summary: Roseburg Public Schools will switch to ParentSquare, a new messaging tool to improve communications and engagement with families, in July. ParentSquare will replace One Call Now and Remind platforms.
